title: Best Fit Orbit Data for Single Solar System Object
description: Standardized MPC JSON format for the exchange of orbit-fit data. Designed to communicate the best-fit orbit for a single minor planet or comet.

CAR.description: Cartesian Element Specification: Description of the best-fit orbit based on a cartesian coordinate system (plus any non-gravs). Contains the best-fit orbit and covariance matrix. Heliocentric coordinates.

element_units.description: Physical Units associated with cartesian orbital elements

elements.description: Best fit values for the cartesian orbital elements.

element_uncertainties.description: Uncertainties on the cartesian orbital elements only (uncertainties on non-gravs are in the non-grav section). NB: These correspond to the (square-root of the) diagonal elements of the cov matrix

parameter_order.description: Mapping from element name (e.g. 'x') to (zero-based) index in covariance-matrix (e.g. 0).

eigval.description: Eigenvalues for the cartesian orbital elements (and any non-gravitational parameters). Of length 6 if gravity-only, or 7-10 if we have non-gravs

covariance.description: Covariance matrix elements (upper triangular) for the cartesian orbital elements (and any non-gravitational parameters). Reconstructed square matrix is of size 6x6 if gravity-only, or 7x7 -to- 10x10 if we have non-grav parameters.

non_grav_coefficients.description: Best fit values for any non-gravitational elements employed in the fit.

yarkovski_coeff.description: Best fit value for Yarkovski coefficient ...

srp_coeff.description: Best fit value for Solar Radiation Pressure coefficient ...

A1_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A1 ...

A2_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A2 ...

A3_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A3 ...

DT_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient DT: Only used in yc (Yeomans & Chodas) model

non_grav_uncertainties.description: Uncertainties on any non-gravitational elements only (uncertainties on elements are in the elements section). NB: These correspond to the (square-root of the) diagonal elements of the cov matrix

yarkovski_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for Yarkovski coefficient ...

srp_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for Solar Radiation Pressure coefficient ...

A1_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A1 ...

A2_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A2 ...

A3_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A3 ...

DT_coeff.description: Uncertainty on the best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient DT: Only used in yc (Yeomans & Chodas) model

COM.description: Description of the best-fit orbit based on the cometary coordinate system (plus any non-gravs). Contains the best-fit orbit and covariance matrix. Heliocentric coordinates.

element_units.description: Physical Units associated with cartesian orbital elements

elements.description: Best fit values for the cometary orbital elements.

element_uncertainties.description: Uncertainties on the best fit values for the cometary orbital elements.

parameter_order.description: Mapping from element name (e.g. 'x') to (zero-based) index in covariance-matrix (e.g. 0).

eigval.description: Eigenvalues for the cometary orbital elements (and any non-gravitational parameters). Of length 6 if gravity-only, or 7-10 if we have non-gravs

covariance.description: Covariance matrix elements (upper triangular) for the cometarian orbital elements (and any non-gravitational parameters). Reconstructed square matrix is of size 6x6 if gravity-only, or 7x7 -to- 10x10 if we have non-grav parameters.

non_grav_coefficients.description: Best fit values for any non-gravitational elements employed in the fit.

yarkovski_coeff.description: Best fit value for Yarkovski coefficient ...

srp_coeff.description: Best fit value for Solar Radiation Pressure coefficient ...

A1_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A1 ...

A2_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A2 ...

A3_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A3 ...

DT_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient DT: Only used in yc (Yeomans & Chodas) model

non_grav_uncertainties.description: Uncertainties on any non-gravitational elements only (uncertainties on elements are in the elements section). NB: These correspond to the (square-root of the) diagonal elements of the cov matrix

yarkovski_coeff.description: Best fit value for Yarkovski coefficient ...

srp_coeff.description: Best fit value for Solar Radiation Pressure coefficient ...

A1_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A1 ...

A2_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A2 ...

A3_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient A3 ...

DT_coeff.description: Best fit value for non-Gravitational Coefficient DT: Only used in yc (Yeomans & Chodas) model

designation_data.description: The designations, numbers and names that may be associated with the object

software_data.description: Details of the software used to perform orbital fit and to create mpcorb output file

fitting_software_name.description: name of software used to perform orbit-fit

software_version.description: version of software used to perform orbit-fit

fitting_datetime.description: datetime at which the orbit fitting software was executed [null should only allowed for template]

mpcorb_schema_version.description: version of the mpcorb schema used to validate this json

mpcorb_schema_sha256.description: sha256 hash of the mpcorb schema used to create this json

mpcorb_creation_datetime.description: datetime at which the mpcorb software was executed to create this json [null should only allowed for template]

system_data.description: Ephemeris model assumed when integrating the motion of the object, and the frame of reference used to specify the best-fit orbital elements.

eph.description: The ephemeris model used in the orbit-fit, E.g. DE431

EclipticObliquityArcseconds.description: Obliquity angle from JPL 777 (heliocentric IAU76/J2000 ecliptic)

refframe.description: The frame of reference for the best-fit orbital elements

force_model.description: The planetary / asteroidal perturbers that were used in the orbit-fit. [need to decide exactly how to populate: url-link?]

orbit_fit_statistics.description: Summary fit statistics associated with the best-fit orbit, the observations used, etc

snr_below_3.description: True if any value in the SNR list is <3, False otherwise

snr_below_1:.description: True if any value in the SNR list is <1, False otherwise

orbit_quality.description: Orbit quality: good, poor, unreliable, no orbit (def = good)

nobs_total.description: Total number of all observations (optical + radar) available

nobs_total_sel.description: Total number of all observations (optical + radar) selected

nobs_optical.description: Total number of optical observations available

nobs_optical_sel.description: Total number of optical observations selected

nobs_radar.description: Total number of radar observations available

nobs_radar_sel.description: Total number of radar observations selected

numparams.description: Number of parameters used for fit: E.g. 6-orbital params plus N-non_grav params

non_grav_model.description: Booleans to indicate whether any non-gravitational parameters are used in the orbit-fit. The actual fitted values and their covariance properties are reported within the CAR and COT parameter sections.

non_gravs.description: Boolean to indicate whether any non-gravitational parameters are used in the orbit-fit.

non_grav_booleans.description: Booleans to indicate which specific non-gravitational model and non-gravitational parameters are used in the orbit-fit.

DT.description: Non-Gravitational Coefficient DT boolean: Only used in yc (Yeomans & Chodas) model

non_grav_units.description: Physical Units associated with any non-gravitational fit-parameters.

magnitude_data.description: The absolute magnitude, H, and slope parameter, G, information derived from the fitted orbit in combination with the observed apparent magnitudes.

epoch_data.description: Data concerning the orbit epoch: I.e. The date at which the best-fit orbital coordinates are correct [double-check: Does TT ++ TDT???]

moid_data.description: Calculated MOIDs (Minimum Orbital Interception Distances) at Epoch

categorization.description: Various different ways to categorize / sub-set orbit / object types
